podcast.name: 60-Second Science
podcast.description: Tune in every weekday for quick reports and commentaries on the world of science&mdash;it&#039;ll just take a minute

podcast_episode.title: What Better Gift for the Holidays Than a Monstrous Mystery?
podcast_episode.name: What Better Gift for the Holidays Than a Monstrous Mystery?
podcast_episode.description: <p>We’re looking back at 2023 for our favorite podcast shows and one about the largest bird to ever fly the skies just flew to the top of the list.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - What Better Gift for the Holidays Than a Monstrous Mystery?.mp3

podcast_episode.title: Are Orca Whales Friends or Foes?
podcast_episode.name: Are Orca Whales Friends or Foes?
podcast_episode.description: <p>The stories we tell about orcas might say more about us than about them</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Are Orca Whales Friends or Foes?.

podcast_episode.title: Turns Out Undersea Kelp Forests Are Crucial to Salmon
podcast_episode.name: Turns Out Undersea Kelp Forests Are Crucial to Salmon
podcast_episode.description: <p>The beloved fish that feed orcas and humans depend on kelp forests’ unique habitat.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Turns Out Undersea Kelp Forests Are Crucial to Salmon.

podcast_episode.title: Researchers Just Created the World's First Permafrost Atlas of the Entire Arctic
podcast_episode.name: Researchers Just Created the World's First Permafrost Atlas of the Entire Arctic
podcast_episode.description: <p>The Arctic Permafrost Atlas, which took years to create, is both beautiful and sobering, given the pace of climate change.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Researchers Just Created the World's First Permafrost Atlas of the Entire Arctic.

podcast_episode.title: A New Type of Heart Disease is on the Rise
podcast_episode.name: A New Type of Heart Disease is on the Rise
podcast_episode.description: <p>Problems with the heart, kidneys and metabolic health are all connected</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A New Type of Heart Disease is on the Rise.

podcast_episode.title: AI Can Now Read Your Cat's Pain
podcast_episode.name: AI Can Now Read Your Cat's Pain
podcast_episode.description: <p>Thanks to researchers, new AI tech is delving into feline feelings to see when cats could need medical help. </p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - AI Can Now Read Your Cat's Pain.

podcast_episode.title: These Researchers Put Sperm Through a Kind of 'Hunger Games'
podcast_episode.name: These Researchers Put Sperm Through a Kind of 'Hunger Games'
podcast_episode.description: <p>The research focused on figuring out what enables certain sperm to gain some competitive advantage over millions of others fighting for the same prize.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - These Researchers Put Sperm Through a Kind of 'Hunger Games'.

podcast_episode.title: Is Too Little Play Hurting Our Kids?
podcast_episode.name: Is Too Little Play Hurting Our Kids?
podcast_episode.description: <p>A long-term decline in unsupervised activity may be contributing to mental health declines in children and adolescents.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Is Too Little Play Hurting Our Kids?.

podcast_episode.title: How Misinformation Spreads through Conflict
podcast_episode.name: How Misinformation Spreads through Conflict
podcast_episode.description: <p>Three experts break down how misinformation and propaganda spread through conflict and how to debunk it yourself.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - How Misinformation Spreads through Conflict.

podcast_episode.title: Why Childhood Vaccination Rates Are Falling
podcast_episode.name: Why Childhood Vaccination Rates Are Falling
podcast_episode.description: <p>Fewer kids got their routine childhood vaccines since before the pandemic. Are lack of access and a loss of trust in science to blame?</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Why Childhood Vaccination Rates Are Falling.

podcast.name: Plays Well with Others
podcast.description: From Creative Commons, a podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley.

podcast_episode.title: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.name: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?.m4a

podcast_episode.title: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.name: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - I Laughed So Hard I Cried.m4a

podcast_episode.title: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.name: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.description: <p>From Creative Commons, a new podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we’re going to explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley. Premieres Tuesday, February 19.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - Coming Soon.mp3
